intro: Delilia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered delilia, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet and blue. The plant has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Delilia biflora is primarily found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
